casebody.data:
AMERICAN RADIUM CO. v. HIPP. DIDISHEIM CO., Inc., et al. (Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. March 27, 1922.) No. 238. Appeal from ihe District Court of the United States for the Southern District of New York. Suit in equity by the American Radium Company against the Hipp. Didisheim Company, Inc., and others. Decree for defendants, and complainant appeals. Affirmed. For opinion below, see 279 Fed. 601. Redding & Greeley, of New York City, Frederick P. Fish, of Boston, Mass., and William A. Redding and Ambrose L. O’Shea, both of New York City, for plaintiff. Pen:iie, Davis, Marvin & Edmonds, of New York City (Dean S. Edmonds, W. Brown Morton, and Chas. H. Studin, all of New York City, of counsel), for defendants.

Before HOUGH and MANTON. Circuit Judges, and Augustus N. IAND, District Judge.

PER CURIAM.

Decree affirmed;
